strategy: Collegia Titanica armies have a Strategy Rating of 3.
Initiative: Battle Titan formations and the Warhounds formation have an Initiative Rating of 1+. All other formations have an Initiative Rating of 2+. In addition, the Questoris Banner formation is subject to the 'Bravery' special rule.

formations.name: 0-1 Emperor Titan
formations.units: One Imperator Titan or Warmonger Titan, Veteran Princeps

formations.name: Warlord Titan
formations.units: One Warlord Titan (Deathbringer or Nemesis Class), Veteran Princeps

formations.name: Reaver Titan
formations.units: One Reaver Titan (Hun or Goth Class)

sections.name: Recon Formations
sections.description: Up to two Recon formations for each Battle Titan formation

formations.name: Warhounds

extraUnits: Add one Warhound Titan of the same configuration: 225 points

formations.name: Questoris Banner

sections.name: Support Formations
sections.description: Up to two Support formations for each Battle Titan formation

extraUnits: Replace up to four Secutarii Hoplites with Electro-Priests: Free

formations.name: Kastelan Maniple

usage: v1.0.0: Titan lists are at the edge of what the EA ruleset can handle, and the Collegia Titanica list is part of an attempt to make such lists less of a Draw or Loss kind of lists.

A (very) partial change-list involves changes to stat lines (making it easier to engage Titans in CC, fewer DC, Shield on certain Titans), pricing (generally cheaper), introducing new rules (Split Fire to give the largest titans more flexibility and moves them closer to how things work in A-T 2018. The God Machine rule to make it worth attacking them) and the Void Shield rule change (preventing big WE from completely recharging fully depleted VS with a single action).
